name: United Arab Emirates
description: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is a federation of seven emirates located on the southeast coast of the Persian Gulf. Known for its stunning desert landscapes, luxurious cities, and rich cultural heritage, the UAE offers a diverse range of experiences, from thrilling desert adventures to world-class shopping and dining. It’s a rapidly developing nation with a strong focus on tourism, trade, and innovation.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The UAE boasts a diverse population comprising citizens and expatriates from around the globe.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides in the emirates of Dubai and Abu Dhabi.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Abu Dhabi serves as the political and cultural center of the UAE.
quickFacts.detail: It’s a sprawling city with impressive architecture and a rich history.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The official currency of the UAE is the Dirham.
quickFacts.detail: It's pegged to the US dollar at a rate of 3.6725 AED = 1 USD.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: The UAE is a relatively small country with diverse geographical features.
quickFacts.detail: It comprises a mix of deserts, coastline, and oases.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: The UAE has a robust and diversified economy.
quickFacts.detail: Oil and gas remain significant contributors, but tourism, finance, and real estate are also key sectors.

climateData.title: Climate Overview
climateData.description: The UAE experiences a hot and arid climate, with significant temperature variations between summer and winter. Rainfall is scarce, primarily occurring during the winter months.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This is the hottest and most humid period, with temperatures often exceeding 40°C (104°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures begin to moderate, with pleasant days and cooler evenings. Rainfall increases slightly.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winters are mild and dry, with average temperatures ranging from 18°C to 24°C (64°F to 75°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures rise again, bringing warm and sunny days. It’s a beautiful time to visit with blooming flowers.

naturalWonders.name: Wadi Rum
naturalWonders.description: Wadi Rum is a protected desert wilderness in southern Jordan, bordering the UAE. It’s renowned for its dramatic sandstone mountains, vast sand dunes, and ancient rock inscriptions, offering a truly otherworldly experience.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The area is steeped in Bedouin culture and history, with opportunities for jeep tours, camel treks, and stargazing. The colors of the sandstone change dramatically with the light, creating a constantly evolving landscape.
viewingTips: Bring sunscreen, a hat, and sunglasses.
Dress in layers as temperatures can fluctuate dramatically.

naturalWonders.name: Fujairah Mountains
naturalWonders.description: The Fujairah Mountains, located on the eastern coast of the UAE, offer a surprising contrast to the desert landscape. These rugged mountains are home to diverse flora and fauna, and provide stunning views of the Gulf of Oman.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mountains are characterized by their limestone cliffs, deep valleys, and lush vegetation. Hiking trails wind through the area, offering opportunities to explore the natural beauty and discover hidden waterfalls.

naturalWonders.name: Ras Al Khaimah Coastal Cliffs
naturalWonders.description: The coastal cliffs of Ras Al Khaimah offer dramatic views of the Arabian Gulf and are a haven for seabirds and marine life.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: These towering cliffs are sculpted by the relentless force of the waves, creating a stunning and dynamic coastline. The area is also home to several secluded beaches and hidden coves.

scientificData.Age: Geologically young, shaped by recent erosion

ecosystemData.title: Desert Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: The UAE’s landscape is dominated by vast deserts, characterized by extreme temperatures, scarce rainfall, and unique plant and animal life adapted to these harsh conditions.  These ecosystems are fragile and require careful management.

biodiversityCategories.name: Desert Flora
biodiversityCategories.description: Despite the arid conditions, the desert supports a surprising variety of plant life, including succulents, cacti, and drought-resistant shrubs.

statistics.details: Adapted to store water in their leaves and stems.
Possess spines for protection and water conservation.

notableSpecies.name: Date Palm
notableSpecies.significance: A vital food source for both humans and animals.

notableSpecies.name: Desert Rose
notableSpecies.significance: A beautiful flowering cactus adapted to extreme conditions.

biodiversityCategories.name: Desert Fauna
biodiversityCategories.description: The desert is home to a range of animals, including reptiles, birds, and mammals, many of which are nocturnal to avoid the heat.

statistics.details: Lizards and snakes are well-adapted to the desert environment.
Migratory birds rely on the UAE as a stopover point.

notableSpecies.name: Arabian Urial
notableSpecies.significance: A wild sheep species found in the UAE's mountains.

notableSpecies.name: Sandgrouse
notableSpecies.significance: A bird adapted to carrying water in its feathers.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities
activities.description: The UAE offers a wide range of outdoor activities, catering to all levels of experience and fitness.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the rugged mountains and desert landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Jebel Hafeet Hike
activities.description: Hike to the summit of Jebel Hafeet, the highest mountain in the UAE, for panoramic views.

activities.name: Wadi Shawka Trail
activities.description: A scenic trail through a wadi (dry riverbed) with lush vegetation.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water activities in the Arabian Gulf.

activities.name: Jet Skiing
activities.description: Experience the thrill of riding a jet ski across the turquoise waters.

activities.name: Diving & Snorkeling
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life of the UAE.

clothing.summer: Lightweight, breathable clothing, swimwear, hat, sunglasses.
clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, including a jacket, sweater, and long pants.

equipment.hiking: Sturdy hiking shoes, backpack, map, compass.
